address: Multiple locations serving New York City
intake_process: Contact via phone (646-619-3277) or email for intake assessment. Veterans must provide proof of veteran status (DD-214) and income verification. Services available for homeless prevention and rapid re-housing. Eligibility requires very low income (at or below 50% AMI) and documented homelessness or at-risk status.
service_area: New York City (Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, Bronx, Staten Island). HELP USA operates multiple locations throughout NYC providing SSVF services to veteran families.

intake_process: Contact by phone at (914) 595-0968 for Westchester/Rockland/Putnam region or (845) 926-9914 for Dutchess/Ulster/Orange/Sullivan region. Initial phone screening followed by in-person intake assessment. Veterans must have DD-214 and income verification. Services include case management, temporary financial assistance for rent/utilities, job coaching, and housing counseling.
service_area: Six-county region: Westchester County (primary), Rockland County, Putnam County, Dutchess County, Orange County, and Ulster County. WestCOP has two regional offices serving approximately 402 eligible veteran households.

intake_process: Apply online, call (315) 424-1800 during business hours (Monday-Friday, 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM), or visit Cathedral Emergency Services building at 262 E Onondaga Street, Syracuse, NY 13202. Intake includes verification of veteran status (DD-214), income assessment (must be at or below 50% of area median income), and documentation of homelessness or imminent housing loss.
service_area: Onondaga County and surrounding Central New York region. Primary service hub in Syracuse with mobile outreach and case management support throughout the county. Serves very low-income veteran families experiencing housing instability.
